intro: Gonolobus guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan morning glory, is a flowering plant belonging to the Convolvulaceae family. It is characterized by its climbing habit and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It is native to tropical regions of South America, including parts of Guyana and Brazil. Gonolobus guianensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories.
